metadata.description: Why has learning become leadership's greatest asset in the age of AI? An account of professional reinvention, lifelong learning and the role of Inteli's MBA in AI and Data for Business in training leaders who know how to learn continuously.

content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice

content_blocks.text: Learning has always been a choice. Today, it is a necessity. In a world where technology redefines the way we work and make decisions, continuous learning has ceased to be a differentiator and has become any leader's greatest asset. In this article, I share how the philosophy oflifelong learninghas shaped every stage of my career and continues to guide my work at Inteli, especially now, when artificial intelligence demands a new attitude towards knowledge from all of us.
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice

content_blocks.text: The end of one career can be the beginning of another
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: The end of one career can be the beginning of another

content_blocks.text: My first professional journey lasted 18 years. AtCia de Talentos, I lived ten careers in one: I learned, made mistakes, grew and led. I started as an intern, became CEO and then the Advisory Board. And yet, at the age of 37, I felt that a new cycle was calling me.
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: The end of one career can be the beginning of another

content_blocks.text: It was during this period that I came acrossThe 100-Year Lifeby Lynda Gratton and Andrew Scott. The book made a deep impression on me. It reminds us that we're going to live longer, and that life therefore fits into multiple chapters. And if we're going to live longer, it's only natural that what we learned in our 20s will no longer serve us in our 40s.
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: The end of one career can be the beginning of another

content_blocks.text: Sometimes, as happened to me, we discover that it's possible to contribute in areas we never imagined.
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: The end of one career can be the beginning of another

content_blocks.text: Deep transitions will become increasingly common. The question becomes: how will you sustain your relevance over so many years? For me, the answer has always been the same word: learning.
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: The end of one career can be the beginning of another

content_blocks.text: Lifelong learning beyond books
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: Lifelong learning beyond books

content_blocks.text: Changing careers isn't glamorous. It's uncomfortable, challenging and often lonely. When I entered the higher education sector in 2018, I knew little about how this universe worked. I needed to learn quickly, in depth and without hierarchies. It meant active listening, a watchful eye and radical humility.
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: Lifelong learning beyond books

content_blocks.text: That's how I met generous people in my day-to-day life who taught me more than any curriculum could.Maria Mesquita, Geraldo Magela, Thiago Sayão, and later,Maurício Garcia, who became my intellectual safe haven during the transition and then joined me in building Inteli.
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: Lifelong learning beyond books

content_blocks.text: I learned from all of them that leading is also about continuing to learn.And that nobody makes a change of this magnitude alone.
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: Lifelong learning beyond books

content_blocks.text: Where there is will, there are possibilities
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: Where there is will, there are possibilities

content_blocks.text: I have always believed that anyone can learn anything, as long as there is a real willingness to do so.Conrado Schlochauerdescribes this evolution as the transition fromHomo SapienstoHomo Discens: beings who continually learn in order to do better, regardless of the field, time or age.
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: Where there is will, there are possibilities

content_blocks.text: Cristina Junqueira, when asked what she admires most in a professional, answered with precision:being up for it.  For me, this is the common denominator for anyone who wants to lead their own destiny, and today, also to lead well in a world guided by artificial intelligence.
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: Where there is will, there are possibilities

content_blocks.text: This willingness to learn is what differentiates those who observe change from those who build change.
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: Where there is will, there are possibilities

content_blocks.text: And what does this have to do with artificial intelligence?
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: And what does this have to do with artificial intelligence?

content_blocks.text: Everything.
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: And what does this have to do with artificial intelligence?

content_blocks.text: AI is transforming the way we make decisions, collaborate, communicate and create value. And, contrary to what many imagine, it's not a technology that only requires technical skills, it requires leaders capable of navigating uncertainty, asking good questions and translating data into action.
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: And what does this have to do with artificial intelligence?

content_blocks.text: Learning to work with AI isn't about mastering a code; it's about developing the repertoire to understand its impacts and apply it responsibly, strategically and humanely.
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: And what does this have to do with artificial intelligence?

content_blocks.text: That's why I often say that if learning used to be a differentiator, today it is the infrastructure of leadership.
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: And what does this have to do with artificial intelligence?

content_blocks.text: And here comes the role of Inteli's MBA in AI and Data for Business.
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: And here comes the role of Inteli's MBA in AI and Data for Business.

content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice

content_blocks.text: The MBA is not the end of a journey. It's a turning point: that moment when you decide to be the protagonist of your own reinvention.
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: And here comes the role of Inteli's MBA in AI and Data for Business.

content_blocks.text: Learning is always a leader's greatest power
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: Learning is always a leader's greatest power

content_blocks.text: If there's one thing that Inteli has taught me over the last few years, it's that leadership isn't about knowing everything, it's about always being open to learning. It's about curiosity, courage and intellectual humility. In the age of artificial intelligence, this attitude is not optional. It is decisive.
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: Learning is always a leader's greatest power

content_blocks.text: And I'm still here, as an eternal learner. Reinventing, studying, making mistakes, evolving, and deeply believing that, while we learn, we remain alive, relevant and connected to what matters.
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: Learning is always a leader's greatest power

content_blocks.text: Because a leader's greatest asset isn't their position, their background or their technical expertise.It's their tireless willingness to keep learning.
content_blocks.section: The journey of an eternal apprentice
content_blocks.subsection: Learning is always a leader's greatest power
